description: The US will impose new sanctions on Iran targeting the country’s missile and drone program following its weekend attack on Israel that threatened to push the Middle East into a wider conflict.
title: US Will Sanction Iranian Drone Program After Attack on Israel

description: Congressional leaders are discussing how to push ahead with legislation that would place sanctions on importers of Iranian oil, with the issue gaining momentum after the nation’s direct attack on Israel, Senator Ben Cardin said Tuesday.
title: Congressional Leaders Discussing Iran Oil Sanctions, Senator Cardin Says

description: The US reiterated to China its concerns over what it sees as industrial overcapacity in the world’s second-largest economy, prompting Beijing officials to push back against that accusation.
title: US and China Lock Horns Again on Industrial Overcapacity Claims

description: Iran’s attack on Israel over the weekend is complicating plans by the Islamic Republic’s foreign minister to visit New York for a United Nations session on Thursday.
title: Iranian Diplomat’s UN Visit Stirs US Angst After Israel Attack

description: China’s exports to Russia slumped in March, the first year-on-year decline since mid-2022, amid growing US threats of reprisal against Beijing if goods aid Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: China’s Exports to Russia Slump Amid US Threat of War Sanctions

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron looks at how the 2024 presidential campaign will be playing out over the next few weeks. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Gets to Hit the Campaign Trail as Trump Gets Stuck in Court

description: The United Nations envoy to Libya said he’d tendered his resignation, lamenting deteriorating conditions in the OPEC member state that’s been wracked by years of conflict.
title: UN Libya Envoy Tenders Resignation as Risks Mount in OPEC Nation

description: A long-delayed bid to write a new law for stablecoins is getting a push from an unexpected lawmaker: crypto-skeptic Sherrod Brown.
title: Push for Stablecoin Law Gets Surprise Boost from Senate’s Sherrod Brown

description: The Solomon Islands goes to the polls on Wednesday and analysts say Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare faces an uphill battle for reelection, with potential implications for China’s position in the South Pacific.
title: China, Taiwan Ties Hang in the Balance in Solomon Islands Vote

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said the prospect of interest rate cuts later this year would lift the mood of voters, hinting that Prime Minister Rishi Sunak won’t call a general election until the fall.
title: Jeremy Hunt Says Rate Cuts Would Lift UK Mood, Hints at Fall Vote

description: A Czech-led initiative to obtain ammunition for Ukraine may deliver a total of 1.5 million artillery shells within a year, which could help Kyiv overcome a worsening shortage of firepower, Prime Minister Petr Fiala said during a visit to the US.
title: Czech Plan May Bring 1.5 Million Artillery Shells to Ukraine, Premier Says

description: The US government has submitted assurances that would pave the way for Wikileaks founder Julian Assange’s extradition while it considers a possible plea deal.
title: US Considers Plea Deal for Wikileaks Founder Julian Assange

description: Texas borrowers gathered at an industry conference bemoaned two Republican-backed laws in the state that issuers say have restricted which Wall Street banks they can do business with.
title: Texas Muni Borrowers Bemoan Anti-ESG Laws Restricting Banks

description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro said he will cut all remaining diplomatic ties with Ecuador over its raid on Mexico’s embassy this month.
title: Maduro Cuts Venezuela’s Diplomatic Ties With Ecuador After Raid

description: Mayor Quinton Lucas seeks to attract those who have newly arrived in the US to fill jobs in the expanding region.
title: NYC Migrants Are Being Welcomed by Kansas City’s Mayor to Fill Jobs

description: President Joe Biden will meet with some 200 steelworkers in Pittsburgh on Wednesday to address an important constituency for both him and his political rival ahead of November’s presidential election.
title: Biden to Court 200 Union Workers in Pittsburgh With Steel Deal in Crosshairs

description: El barómetro electoral de Bloomberg para las elecciones de México 2024 muestra que la candidata de la oposición Xóchitl Gálvez no avanzó en las encuestas posteriores al primer debate presidencial
title: Encuestas de México posdebate muestran que Gálvez no avanza

description: Bloomberg's poll tracker for the Mexico 2024 elections shows that the opposition candidate Xochitl Galvez failed to gain any grounds against frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum after the first debate
title: Mexico Post-Debate Polls Show Galvez Flat, Deepening Opposition's Challenge

description: The European Union should consider consolidation for telecom operators as a way to improve the bloc’s mobile and fixed networks and should further integrate its energy markets, according to a report it commissioned on competitiveness.
title: EU Report Calls for Telecom Consolidation, Strong Energy Market

description: It took less than a day after the UK and US banned future sales of Russian aluminum, copper and nickel on the London Metal Exchange before traders had zeroed in on a way to make money off the convoluted new rules.
title: Traders Are Already Gaming the New Sanctions on Russian Metal

description: The US Supreme Court voiced concern about a criminal charge levied against hundreds of Jan. 6 Capitol riot defendants, as the justices weighed a case that could affect the election-interference prosecution of former President Donald Trump.
title: Supreme Court Questions Jan. 6 Riot Charge in Case That Could Affect Trump

description: Texas’s chief financial officer told bankers on Tuesday that he wants as many companies involved in the state as possible even as probes into banks’ ESG policies threaten their ability to do business.
title: Texas CFO Welcomes Bankers Even as He Compiles Boycott List

description: At least 29 suspected Maoist rebels were killed and one security personnel was injured in a gun battle in the central Indian state of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, three days before the start of national polls.
title: Indian Police Kill 29 Suspected Maoist Rebels in Chhattisgarh

description: Former President Donald Trump’s plan to raise tariffs on US imports would spark a “free for all” in the global trading system that renders existing rules useless and hurts every economy, the head of the World Trade Organization said.
title: WTO Chief Warns of ‘Free for All’ Under Trump’s Plan to Raise Tariffs

description: The escalating conflict between Iran and Israel has refocused the world’s attention on the Islamic Republic’s nuclear ambitions, and whether they’re giving it the capability to fire an atomic weapon. Iran began ramping up production of fissile material in recent years, after the US pulled out of a deal under which Tehran curtailed its nuclear activities in exchange for sanctions relief. Today, it would likely be able to produce a bomb’s worth of the necessary enriched uranium in less than a week
title: How Close Is Iran to Having a Nuclear Weapon?

description: Latvia is preparing to make its first shipment of drones to Ukraine as a coalition of countries aim to provide a million unmanned aerial vehicles to Kyiv.
title: Latvia Readies First Drones for Kyiv Under Plan for Million Drones

description: Liechtenstein, the world’s second-richest country, is set to become the newest member of the International Monetary Fund.
title: Centuries-Old Principality Set to Become IMF’s Youngest Member

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is moving closer to finalizing its “Plan B” to offer broad relief for student-loan borrowers, a signature initiative with implications for his reelection hopes in November.
title: Biden Moves to Finalize First Set of Alternative Student-Debt Rules

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson’s job is in new peril as a second Republican said he would join an effort to depose the Republican leader following his proposal to fund aid to Ukraine and Israel.
title: Speaker Johnson’s Ukraine, Israel Plan Spurs New Ouster Threat

description: Israel is vowing to retaliate against Iran for its weekend drone and missile attack, the first strike on the Jewish state from Iranian soil and which brought into the open a years-long shadow war. As the US and Europe urge restraint, Israel is weighing its choices.
title: What Are Israel’s Options for Retaliating Against Iran’s Drone and Missile Strike?

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz urged Chinese President Xi Jinping to use his influence to try to push Russia into ending what the German leader called its “insane” war on Ukraine.
title: Scholz Asks Xi to Exert Pressure on Putin to End ‘Insane’ War

description: Donald Trump at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York City on April 15. Photographer: Jabin Botsford/AFP
title: Updates From Trump Hush-Money Criminal Trial in New York

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned of the risk of a “catastrophic” escalation in the Middle East as he urged restraint in a phone call with Iranian counterpart Ebrahim Raisi.
title: Putin Urges Iran’s Raisi to Avoid ‘Catastrophic’ Conflict

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned that her department is prepared to use its economic tools against Iran in response to its recent attack on Israel.
title: Yellen Says US Won’t Hesitate to Slap New Sanctions on Iran

description: Donald Trump will meet Polish President Andrzej Duda for a dinner at Trump Tower in New York on Wednesday, according to people familiar with the arrangements.
title: Trump to Meet Polish President Duda in New York on Wednesday

description: The International Monetary Fund inched up its expectations for global economic growth this year, citing strength in the US and some emerging markets, while warning the outlook remains cautious amid persistent inflation and geopolitical risks.
title: IMF Lifts Growth Forecast for Global Economy But Warns of Risks
Sunak Faces Election With Second Lowest Growth in G-7, IMF Warns

description: A far-right political conference being staged in Brussels with the support of Hungarian groups backed by Prime Minister Viktor Orban descended into chaos Tuesday as Belgian authorities tried to shut it down.
title: Spat Over Hungarian-Backed Right-Wing Event Flares in Brussels

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Labour and Law: Unemployment Rises and Politicians Criminalise Deepfakes

description: Iceland postponed its budget surplus target by two years, while the Atlantic nation’s government still pledged to focus on bringing down inflation and paving the way to reduce the western Europe’s highest borrowing costs.
title: Iceland Delays Return to Fiscal Surplus in New Budget Plan

description: The European Union aims to propose fresh sanctions on Iran over its strike on Israel as early as next week when the bloc’s top diplomats meet to discuss the limited options they have for constraining both nations’ activity.
title: EU Aims for New Iran Sanctions Over Israel Strike in Coming Days

description: Zimbabwe’s new central bank governor vowed to restore confidence in the institution that’s repeatedly failed to stabilize prices and the nation’s currency.
title: ‘John the Second’ Vows to Restore Zimbabwe Central Bank’s Status

description: Iran’s unprecedented attack on Israel and the prospect of escalating hostilities has threatened to embroil Jordan, a key Western ally and a country regarded by Gulf states as pivotal to their own security.
title: Iran’s Growing Conflict With Israel Puts US Ally Jordan on Edge

description: Moldova is set to hold a presidential election and a referendum on joining the European Union on Oct. 20 after a court approved a draft amendment to the constitution defining European integration as a strategic objective.
title: Moldova Sets Date for Crucial Presidential Election, EU Vote

description: Rishi Sunak faces a backlash from Conservative lawmakers in a vote to ban smoking for future generations, further exposing the divisions undermining his leadership.
title: Sunak’s Smoking Ban to Expose Tory Splits in UK Commons Vote

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi to Meet Elon Musk Amid The World’s Biggest Election: India Votes

description: New Mexico’s southernmost congressional district is home to haunts of Billy the Kid, the site of the first atomic bomb detonation and the most political turnovers in recent US House history.
title: Border Crisis Is Personal in Battleground US House District

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin Thrives on West’s Paralysis in Aiding Ukraine

description: New Zealand needs to check government spending for it to successfully tame inflation, Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said weeks before releasing his administration’s first fiscal blueprint.
title: New Zealand PM Says Fiscal Restraint Key to Taming Prices, Stoking Growth

description: Ukrainian and Western officials see Russia’s escalated bombardment of Ukraine’s No. 2 city as a way to force the evacuation of civilians, they said.
title: Russia Is Trying to Force Ukrainians to Abandon Their Second-Biggest City

description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will stay on as a senior minister after he steps down, the Straits Times reported, citing incoming premier Lawrence Wong.
title: Singapore PM Lee to Stay On as Senior Minister, Straits Times Reports

description: Competition is heating up between China and the US in the southern Pacific, with each seeking to build influence among island nations that haven’t received much superpower attention since World War II. The stakes rose in 2022 when the Solomon Islands signed a security accord with Beijing — a first for the region — raising fears in Australia and New Zealand, both US allies, about a possible Chinese military base in the neighborhood. That prompted a flurry of regional diplomacy and pledges of aid
title: Why US and China Compete for Influence With Pacific Island Nations

description: Exports swelled to 3.95 million barrels a day in the week to April 14
title: Russian Crude Shipments Surge to the Highest in Almost a Year

description: Joe Biden came into office in 2021 vowing to undo Donald Trump’s harsh policies on the US’s southern border and work with governments across Central America to reduce the motivations for their citizens to head north.
title: Biden Once Rejected Trump’s Migrant Policies. Now His Ideas Echo Them

description: President Joe Biden’s home state of Pennsylvania is taking center stage as he seeks to capitalize on Donald Trump’s absence from the trail, targeting a 2024 swing state where a contentious steel deal and persistent unease over the economy have magnified voter concerns about his agenda.
title: Biden Takes 2024 Pitch to Pennsylvania With Trump Stuck in Court

description: The Justice Department’s antitrust enforcers need more funding to crack down on illegal mergers and conduct, unions, small business and advocacy groups told members of Congress Tuesday ahead of Attorney General Merrick Garland’s expected testimony.
title: US Antitrust Funding Jump Urged by Unions, Lobbies, Trade Groups

description: More than 1 million displaced Palestinians have packed the area in the south of Gaza with tents
title: A Detailed Map Shows How Airstrikes and Refugees Reshaped Rafah

description: Tensions between the Philippines and China over competing maritime claims have added to pressures on the peso that has slumped to a seven-month low, and “an escalation would be a big concern” for investors, according to the Southeast Asian nation’s central bank chief.
title: Philippines-China Tensions Hitting Peso, Central Bank Chief Says

description: The hostile new world Emmanuel Macron has been warning Europeans about is rapidly emerging but the French president is still struggling to persuade partners to trust his judgment.
title: Macron’s Push to Arm Europe Is Getting More Urgent — and More Dangerous

description: It isn’t a question of toughness, but of what can be achieved at what cost.
title: Iran Hawks Want to Strike Now. They're Wrong.

description: Croatian President Zoran Milanovic has opposed NATO expansion and condemned military aid to Ukraine as a “deeply immoral” path to prolonging the war with Russia. Now he wants to take the reins of government in Wednesday’s election.
title: Insult-Hurling President Poses Risk to EU in Croatia’s Election

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he’d raise trade, the war in Ukraine and climate issues as talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping started in Beijing, underscoring the growing list of topics the two sides have to address.
title: Scholz Says He Will Raise Trade Rules, Ukraine in Talks With Xi

description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, who’s set a May 15 date for passing the baton to his deputy Lawrence Wong, is leaving behind an economy that’s in a better position than the one he inherited.
title: Singapore Prime Minister Lee’s Scorecard: A Look at the Numbers

description: For most of Singapore’s history as an independent nation, there has been a Lee at the helm. That’s now coming to an end.
title: Singapore Charts New Path After Half-Century of Lee Family Rule

description: China’s top diplomat told Iran that the nations can work together across a range of areas in the future, signaling their ties remain solid following Tehran’s unprecedented attack on Israel.
title: China Tells Iran Cooperation Will Last After Attack on Israel

description: Donald Trump relied on a small cadre of wealthy donors to contribute $23.6 million, about one-third of amount he and the Republican Party raised in March, the latest disclosures to the US Federal Election Commission show.
title: Trump Leans on Small Group of Rich Donors to Fund Campaign

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol pledged to listen to people’s voices more closely and improve the lives of the needy in his first public comments since his conservative party suffered a stinging defeat in parliamentary elections last week.
title: South Korean President Yoon ‘Humbly’ Accepts Election Loss

description: Singapore’s Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong is stepping down on May 15 after two decades in office. Lee, 72, will hand the reins over to his deputy Lawrence Wong, 51, in a widely-telegraphed transition.
title: What Observers Are Saying as Singapore’s Lee Paves Way for Next PM Wong
